intro: Toluifera pereirae, commonly known as the Pernambuco sand-dollar, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils along coastal areas, thriving in humid and warm climates. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces small, hard fruits that contain seeds. Toluifera pereirae is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to coastal environments.
